name: 世界氣候
description: The goal of this course is to provide students a basic understanding of processes within the Earth’s climate system and how these processes shape up the observed geographically heterogeneous distribution of climate. We will first review the basic structures of the climate system, such as the surface energy balance, the water cycle, general circulation of the atmosphere and oceans, and its geographic variability. After that, specific efforts will be made to the descriptions of local climate and the underlying physical processes. Knowledge obtained will then be applied to understand potential climatic changes due to human activities, such as global warming, desertification, tropical deforestation.
goals: 能了解地表暨大氣輻射收支及其平衡
能認識大氣及海洋一般環流
能了解造成區域氣候特徵背後原因
能認知人類活動亦為氣候系統的一部份
